alert.note: Alert for Bedford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 9:28PM EDT until July 19 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN BEDFORD COUNTY... At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms persisted in the southwestern portions of Bedford County. While rainfall has diminished some during the past hour, additional rainfall amounts of 1/2 inch are still possible during the next hour. From 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen in the warned area within the past four hours and additional rainfall will quickly result in runoff and flooding. The area of greatest concern is between Moneta and Huddleston. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bedford... Huddleston... Moneta... Smith Mountain Lake State Park... North Shore... Westlake Corner... Goodview... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
